intro: Brassica alboglabra, commonly known as field mustard, is an annual herbaceous plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its erect stem, alternate leaves that are usually lobed or toothed, and small yellow flowers arranged in racemes. The plant produces small, round pods containing several seeds, which are typically dark brown to black in color. It is native to Europe and Asia but has been naturalized in various parts of the world. Brassica alboglabra is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
